titleStmt.title: The priests routed in their front-guard of tythes. Or an answer to a paper brought in Mr. Naltons name (teacher of Leonard Fosterlane) to some of the inhabitants of that place. Intituled the dreadfull danger of sacriledge, the with-holding of tythes,&c. A true copy whereof is herewith printed. By the shoemaker of Martins Legrand.
titleStmt.author: Nalton, James, 1600-1662.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Hen. Hils and are to be sold at his house in Fleet-yard, and at William Larnars living at the Black-moore near Fleet-Bridge.,

notesStmt.note: P.16 ends with 'Finis', and is followed by 'The dreadfull danger of sacriledge'.
A reply to: Nalton, James The dreadfull danger of sacriledge.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: William Larnars living at the Black-moore near Fleet-Bridge.
